text: from sea to shining sea hi everyone
Anthony Fantino here the Internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for
your review of the new national album
Trouble will find me the National is an
American rock band they've been dropping
full-length albums since the early 2000s
and they're relatively well known for
their very gloomy musical attitude which
is topped with the very deep monie and
somewhat understated vocals or frontman
Matt Berninger many of the band's tracks
follow some pretty slow tempos are
covered with very syrupy slow musical
accompaniment and many of the lyrics
that come through on the national songs
deal with having a difficult time
dealing with personal emotions
heartbreak it's a formula the band has
stuck to pretty passionately even as
different albums of theirs have gone for
slightly different musical vibes like
the band OMS LP boxer which dropped in
2007 which had a pretty strong post-punk
vibe on it but took a much more adult
and mature approach to making music in
this genre we have the band's earlier
stuff as well which did delve into a bit
of Americana all country at some points
and their latest full-length album
before the release of this LP hi violet
was actually so adorned in extra
instrumentation the band was pretty much
in chamber pop territory at that point
and it's pretty safe to say on this new
LP of the Nationals that the band is in
roughly the same territory that they
were on hi violet especially with tracks
like don't swallow the cap on this thing
which are loaded with refined strings
the swell and bounce against very gently
pulsating guitars drums and bass however
hi violet was an LP that I didn't really
care for as much as many other people
did for one there were not enough punchy
highlights on the album that were as
good as lead singles like blood buzz
Ohio and
on top of it the extra instrumentation
that the National were laying into their
songs which was playing very slowly and
really really made the tracks on this LP
in my opinion kind of impenetrable
because the guitars bass and drums
playing under this dreary
instrumentation was already slow and
kind of dreary to begin with in my
opinion it made the band's music rife
with apathy and an interest when clearly
at least to me anyway it felt like they
were going for something a little more
sad and somewhat depressive now even
though I didn't really love hi violet
and this new LP as well sadly maybe the
Nationals approach to making sad music
is a little bit more true to form than
some other sad songs that we know of out
there today that might be a little
bolder in terms of instrumentation and
melody like it or not the Nationals
music really draws a line between music
where sadness or depression is merely
the subject matter in the lyrics and a
song when sadness and depression as a
feeling as an emotion literally
permeates every single element and
characteristic of the music that you're
hearing from the tempo to every piece of
instrumentation to the melody writing
through the chords the lyrics the vocal
delivery and while I may see that in
their music at least the National is
conveying these feelings in a very
personal way as an outsider as a
listener to me the band's music comes
off consistently as sort of boring and
emotionally stunted and melodically
bland listening to this album is like
watching a guy bum around in his New
York City condo in silk pajamas on a
rainy day while listening to losing my
religion on repeat through his iPod
speaker dock with three days of stubble
on his face
now let me say that existential crises
are real and should be face down if you
overcome them they can't become moments
of personal growth or fester if you
completely ignore them however the
crises that Trouble will find me
presents feel so temporary from the
first chord strummed on the opening
track of this LP it doesn't even feel
like there's any reason to get invested
for sure there are moments on this LP
where I feel like the band is channeling
Leonard Cohen a little bit but never do
they come off as dramatic or maybe even
a little bit of magnetic fields comes
through
but the national was just not as quirky
though they don't really try to be as
quirky but I wouldn't say they're as
clever or as melodically memorable
either or as poetic I feel like the band
can definitely be pretty engaging or
dramatic when it comes to writing a hook
or throwing instrumentation out there
the song fireproof is definitely example
but when the verses come through Matt's
vocals the pace of his lyrics and what
they're saying is well to me personally
feel sort of unengaging with how slow
they're moving I guess in a sense I just
get a little impatient waiting for
something that would justify all of this
there are other highlights on here in my
opinion like the song pink rabbits which
is a pretty solid piano ballad
melodically the song demons is very
interesting in its seven eight times
signature puts an interesting groove out
there which the band performs very
nicely so smoothly that it doesn't even
become apparent that the song is in 7/8
and the song sea of love which is one of
the more epic songs on this LP very
passionate background vocals rapid-fire
snare drums shimmering guitars building
instrumentation but once again on this
LP all of these very pretty colors and
pretty pieces of instrumentation pretty
individually meld together and blend
into a uniformly unappealing and
uninspiring it's hard for me to just
dive into these things and say hey this
is great this is great this is great
because I don't really care for the
Nationals music on this record simply
based on its premise all of these ideas
which may be great on paper are filtered
through this very syrupy slow no
justification lethargy Len that just
doesn't really appeal to me
this album in my opinion is just
well-dressed listlessness overall I'm
really sort of feeling a light too
decent for on this record if you've
given it a listen what did you think of
it did you love it did you hate it why
what do you think I should review next
and that's it this review is my opinion
if you don't like it here's a straw I
want to give a shout out to Austin for
being a cool bro Kieran Leonard for
being an even cooler
I want to give a shoutout to Kanye for
not sounding like Death Grips and of
course Justin Bieber don't worry
Cal takes you seriously Cal is a
believer throwing through only the
strong subscribe all mistakes were
intentional Anthony Fantana the National
Trouble will find me forever
[Music]
